authorization_url()[source]¶

Generate the authorization URL for the OAuth2 application.

Returns:

The authorization URL as a string.

Return type:

str

async fetch_token(code)[source]¶

Fetch the OAuth2 token using the provided authorization code.

Parameters:

code (str) – The authorization code received from the authorization server.

Returns:

The token response as a dictionary.

Return type:

dict

Returns:

Return type:

str

auth.handlers module¶

auth.handlers.authorize()[source]¶

Handle the authorization request.

This function generates an authorization code and redirects the user to the provided redirect URI with the authorization code and state as query parameters.

Returns:

A redirect response to the redirect URI with the authorization code and state.

Return type:

Response

auth.handlers.token()[source]¶

Handle the token request.

This function validates the authorization code and client information, then generates an access token if the validation is successful.

Returns:

A JSON response containing the access token and related information, or an error message.

Return type:

Response

auth.login module¶

async auth.login.handle_callback(request)[source]¶

Handles the OAuth2 callback by exchanging the authorization code for an access token.

Parameters:

request – The request object containing the authorization code.

Returns:

A response with the access token or an error message.

Return type:

web.Response

async auth.login.login_user(request)[source]¶

Authenticates a user and returns a JWT token if successful.

Parameters:

request – The request object containing the username and password.

Returns:

A JSON response with the JWT token or an error message.

Return type:

web.json_response

auth.oauth2_server module¶

class auth.oauth2_server.AuthorizationCode(code, client_id, redirect_uri, scope, state)[source]¶

Bases: object

Represents an OAuth2 authorization code.

Parameters:

  • code (str) – The authorization code.

  • client_id (str) – The client ID associated with the code.

  • redirect_uri (str) – The redirect URI associated with the code.

  • scope (str) – The scope associated with the code.

  • state (str) – The state associated with the code.
